articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel is under growing pressure to get more aid into Gaza as the war causes widespread destruction and hunger.
articles.title: More aid trucks expected to roll into Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy appealed to U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Sunday to join an upcoming peace summit as his country struggles to stave off unrelenting attacks by Russia in its 27-month-old invasion.
articles.title: Zelenskiy, from Kharkiv, urges Biden, Xi to join peace summit

articles.author: Samuel Mckeith
articles.description: The number of dead is more than twice the estimated figure local media earlier reported.
articles.title: More than 670 feared dead in Papua New Guinea landslide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te again offered talks with China on Sunday following two days of Chinese war games near the island, saying he looked forward to enhancing mutual understanding and reconciliation.
articles.title: After China drills, Taiwan president again offers talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A delegation of U.S. lawmakers led by Michael McCaul, chair of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, is visiting Taiwan this week, the de facto U.S. embassy said on Sunday.
articles.title: US lawmakers visiting Taiwan this week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: New Caledonia's international airport will remain closed until at least next Sunday, its operator said, nearly two weeks after rioting erupted on the French-ruled Pacific island over a contested electoral reform.
articles.title: New Caledonia airport to remain closed until at least June 2

articles.author: Mohammed Ghobari
articles.description: Yemen's internationally recognized government said the detainees were civilians the Houthis had kidnapped.
articles.title: Yemen's Houthis free more than 100 prisoners

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Comoros President Azali Assoumani pledged on Sunday to work for peace and rapidly grow the economy as he was sworn in for his fourth term in office, following a tense January election which his opponents claim was tainted by voter fraud.
articles.title: Comoros President sworn in for fourth term after disputed poll

articles.author: Andy Bruce
articles.description: Britain's Conservative Party will introduce mandatory national service for 18-year-olds if it wins the national election on July 4, comprising military or community participation, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said on Sunday.
articles.title: Lagging in polls, UK Conservatives pitch national service at 18

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain's foreign minister condemned as "scandalous and execrable" a video posted by his Israeli counterpart suggesting Hamas would be grateful to Spain, in a growing spat between the two countries over the Gaza war.
articles.title: Spain's foreign minister condemns 'scandalous' Israeli flamenco video
